font.p: If we align the tip of [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline] and the tail of [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline], we obtain [mathjaxinline]g[/mathjaxinline]. Now, [mathjaxinline]-w[/mathjaxinline] swaps the tip and tail of [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline], so to find [mathjaxinline]v-w[/mathjaxinline], we fix [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline], align the tip of [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline] with the tip of [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] and draw a vector from the tail of [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] to the tail of [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline]. To find [mathjaxinline]w-v[/mathjaxinline], we repeat the above with the roles of [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] swapped. Or, we can note that [mathjaxinline]w-v=-(v-w)[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]-d=a[/mathjaxinline]. Finally, [mathjaxinline]-v[/mathjaxinline] is the vector with the same magnitude as [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline], but opposite direction to [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline].
